description:
藉由主題式課程，加深學生對該領域實務趨勢認識、議題簡報、實務案例討論與批判分析。
強化學生該領域之實務/任務型英語口語溝通、簡報、寫作表達能力
goals: 提升英語組織與跨文化溝通表達能力
培養實務案例批判及分析能力
拓展國際視野及移動力
促進實務領域的協作能力
syllabus:
**_Sports English_**: Syllabus for Spring Semester         Jan. 17, 2021

Instructor: Chiou-mei Chen     Email: [t22040@ntnu.edu.tw](mailto:t22040@ntnu.edu.tw)       Office: #805, Cheng Building 8th F

**Course Objectives:** This course aims to help students become better English readers through reading selected articles or news reports about the history and development of certain sports events or competitions intensively and extensively. Most of the articles are adapted from sports textbooks, the Internet, or encyclopedia. The sports covered are those that enjoy greater popularity in our daily life and on TV broadcast.

**Course Requirements:**

(1) Regular attendance, any reasonable absences should notify the teacher by submitting a formal leave-record within two weeks. Every absence without getting the school’s approval will result in 5 points of final grade deduction.

(2) Mobile phone communication and notebook computer, e-reader or i-pad using are not allowed during the class and exam time.

(3) Don’t cheat or look around in in-class exercises and examinations. Students who violate the honesty policy will get a failing final grade.

(4) Only copied handouts will be used in this course. Each student should pay about NT$ 50 for copying all the handouts to the class leader before September 21th.

**Grading Policies:** Attendances: 10%; Film-watching and In-class Exercises: 40%; Mid-term oral report and Final Exams: 50%; 25% for each.

**Teaching Schedule:** (tentative; subjected to change if necessary)

**_Week #                    Contents_**                                    

01                             Introduction

02, 03                       _The Olympic Games_

04, 05                       _Track and Field (I) (II)_

06                             _Swimming_

07                  1         _Soccer_

08                              Film Watching (1): _The Cutting Edge_

09                              **Mid-term oral report**

10, 11                       _Gymnastics_; Film Watching (2): _The National Anthem_

12, 13                       _Baseball_

14                             Basketball

15                             Film Watching (3): _The Babe_; _Basketball_

16                             **Final Exam**

**17, 18                       Self-Study Project**
